Node.definition: = action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= man; ◄ son of Manoah (מָנֹוחַ) ► judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= town; ◄ located in Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) ► one of the fives cities of the Philistines (פְּלֶשֶׁת)

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= woman that sells her body for payment, making of this her profession; ≈ often associated with shame and sinful behavior
= inhabitant of Gaza (עַזָּה) town in Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Manoah (מָנֹוחַ) ► judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
literally: to go around; hence: = action by which groups of humans or animals take position all around an individual, a group, or an object

Node.gloss: to lie in wait|to lay an ambush|to lurk
Node.definition: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

see אֹור (אֹור)|= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security
= man; ◄ son of Manoah (מָנֹוחַ) ► judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= a point of time in the middle of a larger period of time
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= a point of time in the middle of a larger period of time
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

Node.gloss: to grasp|to take hold of (something)|to seize|to catch|to hold on (to something)
Node.definition: = to take hold of someone or something; humans typically do this with their hands and animals use their mouths; however, it is often extended to include inanimate objects (traps), personalized qualities (wisdom), emotions (anger, fear), or processes (time)

= a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= upright part of a door frame; a few passages mention square door frames and in such cases the horizontal elements are also referred to as doorposts

Node.gloss: to pull out|to pull up|to uproot|to quarry
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way
a long rigid piece of wood, metal, or similar material, attached in horizontal position to a gate so that it cannot be opened from the outside

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= the joint between each arm and the main part of the human body; ► often used for carrying heavy weights
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= town, formerly known as Kiriath Arba (קִרְיַת אַרְבַּע) ◄ territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► assigned to clan of Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי)
= referent to the time after the event in focus
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= woman; ► lover of Samson (שִׁמְשֹׁון) who caused him to be captured by the Philistines (פְּלִשְׁתִּי)

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= person in charge of a Philistine city
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to lure|to allure|to entice|to coax|to persuade|to seduce|to flatter|to trick|to deceive
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities provoke in (other) humans the will or desire to do something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= state in which an event has a high intensity

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= process by which humans can complete a certain activity successfully
= causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her
= pertaining to being a thousand in number or to happening a thousand times
= state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= woman; ► lover of Samson (שִׁמְשֹׁון) who caused him to be captured by the Philistines (פְּלִשְׁתִּי)
= man; ◄ son of Manoah (מָנֹוחַ) ► judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= state in which an event has a high intensity

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Manoah (מָנֹוחַ) ► judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= relatively thin string; ► used to hold a tent or similar construction in place, but also as bowstring; in Judges 16 used to tie down a person
= state in which a fruit, tree branch, or other natural product still contains some of its internal juices and has not yet dried out
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to make dry|to cause to dry up
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause a state of dryness; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible

Node.gloss: to be, become weak|to be, become powerless|to be sick|to be injured
Node.definition: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= person in charge of a Philistine city
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= relatively thin string; ► used to hold a tent or similar construction in place, but also as bowstring; in Judges 16 used to tie down a person
= state in which a fruit, tree branch, or other natural product still contains some of its internal juices and has not yet dried out
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to make dry|to cause to dry up
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause a state of dryness; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible
= causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control

Node.gloss: to lie in wait|to lay an ambush|to lurk
Node.definition: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time
= area enclosed by walls or partitions, floor, and ceiling; ◄ part of building

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)
= man; ◄ son of Manoah (מָנֹוחַ) ► judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= relatively thin string; ► used to hold a tent or similar construction in place, but also as bowstring; in Judges 16 used to tie down a person
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= relatively thin cord ◄ made of cotton, wool, flax or precious metal; ► used for attaching objects to clothes, hanging small objects around the neck, measuring, tying, etc.

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= action by which humans act dishonestly towards others

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which something that has been said is not truthful
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control

= causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control
= causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control
= piece of cord or chain; ◄ made by twisting together strands of palm fibres, linen, reeds, or gold; ► used for tying and keeping things together
= state in which an object has been in existence for only a short time ◄ because of having recently been built or produced
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time
= area enclosed by walls or partitions, floor, and ceiling; ◄ part of building
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power

= spun out filament, sometimes dyed scarlet; ◄ of cotton, flax, wool, or another material; ► used as strands for making ropes or for measuring the circumference of objects; ≈ regarded as weak and insignificant

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to weave (a thread) into (an existing fabric)
Node.definition: = to weave an object in the shape of a thread into an existing piece of woven fabric in a loom

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= part of a person's hair that coils or hangs together, either or not woven into a braid

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= a piece of woven fabric on a loom
= action by which humans attach one object to another by securing it with a sharp tool
= small, pointed object; ◄ part of weaving equipment; ► used to push the threads of the woof tight

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= process by which humans wake up from sleep
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive

Node.gloss: to pull out|to pull up|to uproot|to quarry
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= small, pointed object; ◄ part of weaving equipment; ► used to push the threads of the woof tight
= small object with two pointed ends; ◄ part of weaving equipment; ► moves the thread of the weft across between threads of the warp; ≈ associated with swiftness

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a piece of woven fabric on a loom

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= state in which a countable entity is three in number
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events
= action by which humans act dishonestly towards others

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= state in which an event has a high intensity

Node.gloss: to nag|to pester|to oppress|to cause distress
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to experience distress, either with words or with actions, ► usually with the purpose of forcing that person to make certain concessions
literally: all the days; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= to cause someone else to experience distress with words, ► usually with the purpose of forcing that person to make certain concessions

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= sharp knife ► used to shave hair from the skin
literally: to go up; hence: = process by which an object appears on top of or over another one

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= causative action by which humans cut the hair on all or part of the body of someone else
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

Node.gloss: to be, become weak|to be, become powerless|to be sick|to be injured
Node.definition: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= woman; ► lover of Samson (שִׁמְשֹׁון) who caused him to be captured by the Philistines (פְּלִשְׁתִּי)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= causative action by which humans or deities send one or more people though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= person in charge of a Philistine city
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= person in charge of a Philistine city
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

Node.gloss: to put to sleep|to lull to sleep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to fall asleep
= central area of the leg where the thigh is joined to the lower leg; ≈ associated with stability and strength
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= causative action by which humans cut the hair on all or part of the body of someone else

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= part of a person's hair that coils or hangs together, either or not woven into a braid

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= action by which humans or deities start performing an event
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)
= man; ◄ son of Manoah (מָנֹוחַ) ► judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= process by which humans wake up from sleep
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to grasp|to take hold of (something)|to seize|to catch|to hold on (to something)
Node.definition: = to take hold of someone or something; humans typically do this with their hands and animals use their mouths; however, it is often extended to include inanimate objects (traps), personalized qualities (wisdom), emotions (anger, fear), or processes (time)
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)
literally: to dig out; hence: = causative action by which humans forcefully remove the eyes of other humans from their sockets to make them blind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to lower|to let down|to take down|to bring down|to take off (ornaments)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to move from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town; ◄ located in Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) ► one of the fives cities of the Philistines (פְּלֶשֶׁת)
= causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control
= causative action by which humans reduce objects to tiny particles or powder with the help of a hand mill or larger millstone; ≈ regarded as a menial task

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= building or part of building ► used for locking up prisoners; ≈ regarded as hardship
= process by which an event starts happening
= the fine thread like strands growing from the skin of humans and certain animals

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= process by which the hair of one's body grows to a certain length
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= causative action by which humans cut the hair on all or part of the body of someone else
= person in charge of a Philistine city
= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)
= process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= a deity; ► worshiped by the Philistines (פְּלִשְׁתִּי)
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= state in which humans feel and show great joy

= man; ◄ son of Manoah (מָנֹוחַ) ► judge of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do

Node.gloss: to destroy|to lay waste|to cause destruction
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans and deities cause total destruction to lands, constructions, or towns, including the people living there, either directly or through the hands of others, to the extent that sedentary life is no more possible there

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object

Node.gloss: to be in high spirits|to be merry
Node.definition: literally: (one's) heart is good; hence: = state in which humans are in high spirits, ◄ usually under the influence of alcohol

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

Node.gloss: to strengthen|to give strength, to fortify|to repair|to let prevail
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause humans and objects to be strong in a physical, political, or military sense
= particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to climb down|to step down|to descend
Node.definition: = action by which human, animals, or deities move (voluntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

= a group of people to which one traces one's ancestry; ◄ smallest unit within family group

= man; ► father of judge Samson (שִׁמְשֹׁון)
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
